text_en: This page intentionally left blank Neurocognitive Disorders Neurocognitive Domains The criteria for the various neurocognitive disorders are all based on defined cognitive domains. Table 1 provides for each of the key do- mains a working definition, examples of symptoms or observations regarding impairments in everyday activities, and examples of as- sessments. The domains thus defined, along with guidelines for clin- ical thresholds, form the basis on which the neurocognitive disorders, their levels, and their subtypes may be diagnosed. Additional infor- mation is provided in DSM-5. 285
